qas.question: How to avoid quarantine in argentina?

answers.text: If you are fully vaccinated, you can enter Argentina as a tourist without needing quarantine.

qas.question: How can i prove my vaccination status when entering argentina?

answers.text: document from a national or state-level public health body

paragraphs.context: If you are fully vaccinated, you can enter Argentina as a tourist without needing quarantine.  At least 14 days must have passed since your second dose of the vaccine. Whether you have received a complete course of a vaccine or not, will be determined by the authorities of the country where you received your vaccine. You must be able to prove your full vaccination status via a document from a national or state-level public health body if vaccinated abroad.

qas.question: How old do children have to be to not be required to test when entering argentina?

paragraphs.context: Children and young people: Children aged 5 and under, do not need to take a test to enter Argentina. Children aged 17 and under who do not qualify as fully vaccinated can enter Argentina without needing to self-isolate but should avoid large gatherings for the first 7 days.
